{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3337783,"name":"Anderson Hall","username":"Xactlysharp","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/xactlysharp/{size}/186572_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-19T23:38:55.934Z","cooked":"

How does one change max speed of a swerve drive on the fly, or as most of our team calls it, a “boost button”

To get more specific, we tried to create a double that we would change to represent x max speed, and then substitute the set max speed in our swerve code with this variable.

Lets just say that the wall now has a dent in it(once changed, no more controlling robot) and it did not go faster.

Any help?

(I can record some videos if needed)
Code:

what you can do is have multiple variables for your max speed during slow and fast mode and then use those for your speed calculations depending on whether a button supplier is active or not

that looks like it’ll work great

you can also add a supplier in your drive command if you want like this

  public static Command joystickDrive(
      Drive drive,
      DriveController driveMode,
      DoubleSupplier xSupplier,
      DoubleSupplier ySupplier,
      DoubleSupplier omegaSupplier,
      BooleanSupplier slowModeSupplier) {

(this is from my team’s code so we have a slow mode but it works exactly the same)

you can then bind that boolean supplier to whatever button you want so that while it’s held you change the speed of the robot

your method works great too neither is better than the other it’s just how my team does it

Style suggestion: consider the name isSlowMode or just slowMode instead of slowModeSupplier. Type information generally doesn’t need to be repeated in variable names; it’s clear from usage (and in tooling) that it’s a supplier.

It ended up not working. The boolean did change between true/false when commanded, but the drivetrain’s did not change, and if the commands were run while driving, the robot would not stop driving.

Can upload video later if needed

so what i think is happening is that you are creating two separate instances of your drivetrain and you’re commanding a second drivetrain to move fast which i think could also explain why the robot keeps moving when you activate it
